question: Which one of the following Federal Courts has the power to declare laws passed by the state or the constituent unit of the federation invalid but not the federal laws?
explanation: The Swiss Federal Tribunal was created in 1874 and its members are elected by the Federal Assembly. Swiss Court is a single court. It does not have subordinate courts. This Federal court has power to declare laws passed by the State or the Constituent unit of the federation invalid but not the federal laws.
